As parents and educators, we need to encourage children to think creatively together and give them palettes with methods on how to learn. Rather than focusing solely on memorization and standardized tests, we should teach them how to discover the world and solve problems in their own unique ways. Let's not stigmatize children for misspellings or minor mistakes, but instead, foster a love of learning to learn and exploration. By doing so, we can help our children become innovative thinkers and problem-solvers, ready to tackle challenges that comes their way. #education #parenting #creativity #innovation #problem-solving

"If you're not prepared to be wrong, you'll never come up with anything Original." Let's not forget creativity is unleashed only when you have the potential to make mistakes and correct them. #lifehack: Don't be afraid to make mistakes, however, make sure you learn from them. #unleashingcreativity #creativethinking #childrenseducation #mentoring #leadershipcoaching #unleashingpotential #mistakesarelessons

Embrace your mistakes, they are a sign of growth. As someone once said, 'If you're not prepared to be wrong, you'll never come up with anything original.' Don't be anxious about making mistakes, it means you're trying something new and taking risks. Keep pushing boundaries and exploring new ideas, even if it means making a few missteps along the way. #growthmindset #innovation

Valuing creativity is important in life and in the workplace. In my work at GLG, I've seen firsthand how those without "creative professional" on their resume bring fresh ideas to the table (my extended team excels at this - our brainstorms are epic). We aren't afraid to fail on the way to our next win. It's also a topic I discuss with my son regularly - "how did you fail today?" is a common after school question we ask each other. Let's recognize and encourage creativity, along with the "failure" it brings, because when we lose it our lives and work suffer. #creativity #workplaceculture
